lead_paragraph: Michael Bradley scored his first international goal in the 86th minute and the United States defeated host Switzerland, 1-0, to stop a five-game losing streak, the longest for the Americans since 1994. Bradley knocked in a loose ball from close range after Clint Dempsey deflected Danny Szetela’s cross into the air. After a 10-0-1 start under Coach Bob Bradley — Michael’s father — the United States lost to Argentina, Paraguay, Colombia, Sweden and Brazil. Freddy Adu, making his second appearance for the national team, entered as a substitute in the 77th and nearly scored in the final minutes of a match that had few opportunities and long stretches of sloppy play.
